messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] RE: coffee was drugs
messages.msgSnippet: ... day!  Starbucks can t match it. I dimly recall that when Starbucks was a new company, they bragged that their beans were never more than a day past
messages.messageBody:
>>>>>>>>>There was *nothing* like fresh coffee brewed from beans roasted that
day! Starbucks can't match it.>>>>>>>>

I dimly recall that when Starbucks was a new company, they bragged that their beans were never more than a day past roasting, or was it a week ?? old. Now you can buy it in foil packages with dates at least 6 months out.

Mary Ellen

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: RE: coffee was drugs
messages.msgSnippet: I don t know from Peets but...Back in the Philadelphia /South NJ area there was a supermarket called Zagara s where they roasted the coffee beans in the store.
messages.messageBody:
I don't know from Peets but...Back in the Philadelphia /South NJ area there
was a supermarket called Zagara's where they roasted the coffee beans in the
store. There was *nothing* like fresh coffee brewed from beans roasted that
day! Starbucks can't match it. I miss it terribly!
Krisula
